radiographic_examinations.findings: Normal sinus rhythm with ST-segment elevation up to 4 mm in leads V3 through V6, hyperacute T waves in leads V4, V5, V6, and ST-segment depressions in inferior leads.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: The ST-segment changes seen on the ECG resolved completely between episodes.

radiographic_examinations.date: Approximately 9 p.m. on the day of admission
radiographic_examinations.findings: 35-mm-long segment of severe narrowing (90% stenosis) in the middle of the left anterior descending artery; smooth contour consistent with intramural hematoma, with distal haziness consistent with dissection site.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Follow-up coronary angiogram 48 hours later showed improved blood flow (TIMI grade 3), a shorter segment of stenosis (approximately 25 mm), and resolution of the distal dissection flap.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Nearly complete resolution of the dissection, minimal irregularities in the left anterior descending artery at the site of the dissection, and normal left ventricular function.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Indicated favorable healing of the coronary-artery dissection.
